newsitem.title: UK: Hyder prepares development site in Vietnam.
newsitem.headline: Hyder prepares development site in Vietnam.

text.p: Wales-based utility group Hyder Plc said on Tuesday it had been assigned to plan and design infrastructure for a $152 million industrial development project outside Hanoi, North Vietnam.
Hyder is working on the site with local partner CDC on behalf of South Korea's Daewoo Corporation, which is a joint venture partner developing the 420 hectare site.
The first phase of the complex, at Saidong, is due for completion in October this year, Hyder said in a statement.
Its engineering and environmental consultants were preparing development plans covering utilities, sewage works, and landscaping planning, it added.

Hanoi Electronic Corporation is the Vietnam partner in the development, intended to encourage foreign investors to establish factories and housing at a town independent of the strained infrastructure of Hanoi itself.
